content:
JpegBitmapEncoder Class

In this Article

Defines an encoder that is used to encode Joint Photographics Experts Group (JPEG) format images.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class JpegBitmapEncoder : System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapEncoder

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DispatcherObject
  • System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapEncoder
  • JpegBitmapEncoder

Inherited Members

Remarks

Joint Photographics Experts Group (JPEG) format bitmaps support frame level thumbnails and frame level metadata. They do not support preview, global thumbnails, global metadata, or multiple frames.

Encoding does not work in partial trust. See WPF Partial Trust Security for information on partial trust.

XAML Text Usage

Constructors summary

JpegBitmapEncoder()

Initializes a new instance of the JpegBitmapEncoder class.

Properties summary

FlipHorizontal

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a Joint Photographics Experts Group (JPEG) image should be flipped horizontally during encoding.
FlipVertical

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a Joint Photographics Experts Group (JPEG) image should be flipped vertically during encoding.
QualityLevel

Gets or sets a value that indicates the quality level of the resulting Joint Photographics Experts Group (JPEG) image.
Rotation

Gets or sets a value that represents the degree to which a Joint Photographics Experts Group (JPEG) image is rotated.

Constructors

  • JpegBitmapEncoder()

    Initializes a new instance of the JpegBitmapEncoder class.

    public JpegBitmapEncoder ();

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to initialize a JpegBitmapEncoder to encode a new bitmap image. 

    BitmapSource^ image = BitmapSource::Create(
   width, height,
   96, 96,
   PixelFormats::Indexed1,
   myPalette,
   pixels,
   stride);

    Dim image As BitmapSource = System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.Create(width, height, 96, 96, PixelFormats.Indexed1, myPalette, pixels, stride)

    BitmapSource image = BitmapSource.Create(
    width,
    height,
    96,
    96,
    PixelFormats.Indexed1,
    myPalette,
    pixels,
    stride);

    
System::IO::FileStream^ stream = gcnew System::IO::FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode::Create);
JpegBitmapEncoder^ encoder = gcnew JpegBitmapEncoder();
TextBlock^ myTextBlock = gcnew System::Windows::Controls::TextBlock();
myTextBlock->Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder->CodecInfo->Author->ToString();
encoder->FlipHorizontal = true;
encoder->FlipVertical = false;
encoder->QualityLevel = 30;
encoder->Rotation = Rotation::Rotate90;
encoder->Frames->Add(BitmapFrame::Create(image));
encoder->Save(stream);

    Dim stream As New FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode.Create)
Dim encoder As New JpegBitmapEncoder()
Dim myTextBlock As New TextBlock()
myTextBlock.Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder.CodecInfo.Author.ToString()
encoder.FlipHorizontal = True
encoder.FlipVertical = False
encoder.QualityLevel = 30
encoder.Rotation = Rotation.Rotate90
encoder.Frames.Add(BitmapFrame.Create(image))
encoder.Save(stream)

    FileStream stream = new FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode.Create);
JpegBitmapEncoder encoder = new JpegBitmapEncoder();
TextBlock myTextBlock = new TextBlock();
myTextBlock.Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder.CodecInfo.Author.ToString();
encoder.FlipHorizontal = true;
encoder.FlipVertical = false;
encoder.QualityLevel = 30;
encoder.Rotation = Rotation.Rotate90;
encoder.Frames.Add(BitmapFrame.Create(image));
encoder.Save(stream);

Properties

  • FlipHorizontal

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a Joint Photographics Experts Group (JPEG) image should be flipped horizontally during encoding.

    public bool FlipHorizontal { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the image is flipped horizontally during encoding; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    XAML Text Usage

    The horizontal flip represents a lossless transformation of the source image and replaces any previous lossless transformation.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to set the value of the FlipHorizontal property. 

    BitmapSource^ image = BitmapSource::Create(
   width, height,
   96, 96,
   PixelFormats::Indexed1,
   myPalette,
   pixels,
   stride);

    Dim image As BitmapSource = System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.Create(width, height, 96, 96, PixelFormats.Indexed1, myPalette, pixels, stride)

    BitmapSource image = BitmapSource.Create(
    width,
    height,
    96,
    96,
    PixelFormats.Indexed1,
    myPalette,
    pixels,
    stride);

    
System::IO::FileStream^ stream = gcnew System::IO::FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode::Create);
JpegBitmapEncoder^ encoder = gcnew JpegBitmapEncoder();
TextBlock^ myTextBlock = gcnew System::Windows::Controls::TextBlock();
myTextBlock->Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder->CodecInfo->Author->ToString();
encoder->FlipHorizontal = true;
encoder->FlipVertical = false;
encoder->QualityLevel = 30;
encoder->Rotation = Rotation::Rotate90;
encoder->Frames->Add(BitmapFrame::Create(image));
encoder->Save(stream);

    Dim stream As New FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode.Create)
Dim encoder As New JpegBitmapEncoder()
Dim myTextBlock As New TextBlock()
myTextBlock.Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder.CodecInfo.Author.ToString()
encoder.FlipHorizontal = True
encoder.FlipVertical = False
encoder.QualityLevel = 30
encoder.Rotation = Rotation.Rotate90
encoder.Frames.Add(BitmapFrame.Create(image))
encoder.Save(stream)

    FileStream stream = new FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode.Create);
JpegBitmapEncoder encoder = new JpegBitmapEncoder();
TextBlock myTextBlock = new TextBlock();
myTextBlock.Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder.CodecInfo.Author.ToString();
encoder.FlipHorizontal = true;
encoder.FlipVertical = false;
encoder.QualityLevel = 30;
encoder.Rotation = Rotation.Rotate90;
encoder.Frames.Add(BitmapFrame.Create(image));
encoder.Save(stream);
  • FlipVertical

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a Joint Photographics Experts Group (JPEG) image should be flipped vertically during encoding.

    public bool FlipVertical { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the image is flipped vertically during encoding; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The vertical flip represents a lossless transformation of the source image and replaces any previous lossless transformation.

    XAML Text Usage

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to set the value of the FlipVertical property. 

    BitmapSource^ image = BitmapSource::Create(
   width, height,
   96, 96,
   PixelFormats::Indexed1,
   myPalette,
   pixels,
   stride);

    Dim image As BitmapSource = System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.Create(width, height, 96, 96, PixelFormats.Indexed1, myPalette, pixels, stride)

    BitmapSource image = BitmapSource.Create(
    width,
    height,
    96,
    96,
    PixelFormats.Indexed1,
    myPalette,
    pixels,
    stride);

    
System::IO::FileStream^ stream = gcnew System::IO::FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode::Create);
JpegBitmapEncoder^ encoder = gcnew JpegBitmapEncoder();
TextBlock^ myTextBlock = gcnew System::Windows::Controls::TextBlock();
myTextBlock->Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder->CodecInfo->Author->ToString();
encoder->FlipHorizontal = true;
encoder->FlipVertical = false;
encoder->QualityLevel = 30;
encoder->Rotation = Rotation::Rotate90;
encoder->Frames->Add(BitmapFrame::Create(image));
encoder->Save(stream);

    Dim stream As New FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode.Create)
Dim encoder As New JpegBitmapEncoder()
Dim myTextBlock As New TextBlock()
myTextBlock.Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder.CodecInfo.Author.ToString()
encoder.FlipHorizontal = True
encoder.FlipVertical = False
encoder.QualityLevel = 30
encoder.Rotation = Rotation.Rotate90

encoder.Save(stream)

    FileStream stream = new FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode.Create);
JpegBitmapEncoder encoder = new JpegBitmapEncoder();
TextBlock myTextBlock = new TextBlock();
myTextBlock.Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder.CodecInfo.Author.ToString();
encoder.FlipHorizontal = true;
encoder.FlipVertical = false;
encoder.QualityLevel = 30;
encoder.Rotation = Rotation.Rotate90;
encoder.Frames.Add(BitmapFrame.Create(image));
encoder.Save(stream);
  • QualityLevel

    Gets or sets a value that indicates the quality level of the resulting Joint Photographics Experts Group (JPEG) image.

    public int QualityLevel { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The quality level of the JPEG image. The value range is 1 (lowest quality) to 100 (highest quality) inclusive.

    Remarks

    XAML Text Usage

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to set the value of the QualityLevel property. 

    BitmapSource^ image = BitmapSource::Create(
   width, height,
   96, 96,
   PixelFormats::Indexed1,
   myPalette,
   pixels,
   stride);

    Dim image As BitmapSource = System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.Create(width, height, 96, 96, PixelFormats.Indexed1, myPalette, pixels, stride)

    BitmapSource image = BitmapSource.Create(
    width,
    height,
    96,
    96,
    PixelFormats.Indexed1,
    myPalette,
    pixels,
    stride);

    
System::IO::FileStream^ stream = gcnew System::IO::FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode::Create);
JpegBitmapEncoder^ encoder = gcnew JpegBitmapEncoder();
TextBlock^ myTextBlock = gcnew System::Windows::Controls::TextBlock();
myTextBlock->Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder->CodecInfo->Author->ToString();
encoder->FlipHorizontal = true;
encoder->FlipVertical = false;
encoder->QualityLevel = 30;
encoder->Rotation = Rotation::Rotate90;
encoder->Frames->Add(BitmapFrame::Create(image));
encoder->Save(stream);

    Dim stream As New FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode.Create)
Dim encoder As New JpegBitmapEncoder()
Dim myTextBlock As New TextBlock()
myTextBlock.Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder.CodecInfo.Author.ToString()
encoder.FlipHorizontal = True
encoder.FlipVertical = False
encoder.QualityLevel = 30
encoder.Rotation = Rotation.Rotate90
encoder.Frames.Add(BitmapFrame.Create(image))
encoder.Save(stream)

    FileStream stream = new FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode.Create);
JpegBitmapEncoder encoder = new JpegBitmapEncoder();
TextBlock myTextBlock = new TextBlock();
myTextBlock.Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder.CodecInfo.Author.ToString();
encoder.FlipHorizontal = true;
encoder.FlipVertical = false;
encoder.QualityLevel = 30;
encoder.Rotation = Rotation.Rotate90;
encoder.Frames.Add(BitmapFrame.Create(image));
encoder.Save(stream);
  • Rotation

    Gets or sets a value that represents the degree to which a Joint Photographics Experts Group (JPEG) image is rotated.

    public System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation Rotation { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Rotation

      The degree to which the image is rotated.

    Remarks

    Rotation is supported only in 90-degree increments.

    The rotation represents a lossless transformation of the source image and replaces any previous lossless transformation.

    XAML Text Usage

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to set the value of the Rotation property. 

    BitmapSource^ image = BitmapSource::Create(
   width, height,
   96, 96,
   PixelFormats::Indexed1,
   myPalette,
   pixels,
   stride);

    Dim image As BitmapSource = System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.Create(width, height, 96, 96, PixelFormats.Indexed1, myPalette, pixels, stride)

    BitmapSource image = BitmapSource.Create(
    width,
    height,
    96,
    96,
    PixelFormats.Indexed1,
    myPalette,
    pixels,
    stride);

    
System::IO::FileStream^ stream = gcnew System::IO::FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode::Create);
JpegBitmapEncoder^ encoder = gcnew JpegBitmapEncoder();
TextBlock^ myTextBlock = gcnew System::Windows::Controls::TextBlock();
myTextBlock->Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder->CodecInfo->Author->ToString();
encoder->FlipHorizontal = true;
encoder->FlipVertical = false;
encoder->QualityLevel = 30;
encoder->Rotation = Rotation::Rotate90;
encoder->Frames->Add(BitmapFrame::Create(image));
encoder->Save(stream);

    Dim stream As New FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode.Create)
Dim encoder As New JpegBitmapEncoder()
Dim myTextBlock As New TextBlock()
myTextBlock.Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder.CodecInfo.Author.ToString()
encoder.FlipHorizontal = True
encoder.FlipVertical = False
encoder.QualityLevel = 30
encoder.Rotation = Rotation.Rotate90
encoder.Frames.Add(BitmapFrame.Create(image))
encoder.Save(stream)

    FileStream stream = new FileStream("new.jpg", FileMode.Create);
JpegBitmapEncoder encoder = new JpegBitmapEncoder();
TextBlock myTextBlock = new TextBlock();
myTextBlock.Text = "Codec Author is: " + encoder.CodecInfo.Author.ToString();
encoder.FlipHorizontal = true;
encoder.FlipVertical = false;
encoder.QualityLevel = 30;
encoder.Rotation = Rotation.Rotate90;
encoder.Frames.Add(BitmapFrame.Create(image));
encoder.Save(stream);
